definition: to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office

sentences.english: If so, the dismissals would not necessarily affect railway development.
sentences.chinese: 如果是这样，撤职官员就可能不会影响铁路的发展。

sentences.english: Management of the firm culpable for its losses will be terminated.
sentences.chinese: 对公司亏损负有责任的管理层将被撤职。

sentences.english: The police rank of any traffic policeman who is imposed upon an administrative sanction below removal from post shall be degraded.
sentences.chinese: 受到撤职以下行政处分的交通警察，应当降低警衔。

sentences.english: The " plotters " were then ordered to be placed under arrest.
sentences.chinese: 这些“阴谋家”被依法撤职逮捕。

sentences.english: The corrupt mayor should be removed from office and prosecuted.
sentences.chinese: 这个腐化堕落的市长应当撤职查办。

sentences.english: Two top officials of the Jinan Railway Bureau were sacked.
sentences.chinese: 济南铁路局的两位高官已被撤职。

sentences.english: He was cashiered for conduct injurious to the reputation of a soldier.
sentences.chinese: 他因品行有损军人的名誉而被撤职。

sentences.english: Zhang Shuguang, another top official in the railways ministry, was later dismissed for corruption.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着，铁道部另一位高官张曙光因贪污而被撤职。

definition: to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to discipline sb/to punish/disciplinary action/to deal with (a matter)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to dismiss and replace (sb)/to replace (sb or sth)
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
